title: Backpropagation: The Algorithm That Changed Everything
description: A short lesson to help you apply Backpropagation: The Algorithm That Changed Everything.

hook.text: In 1986, a paper showed how to teach multi-layer neural networks. The perceptron's curse was broken.

buildup.text: Rumelhart, Hinton, and Williams popularized backpropagation â€” learning by correcting errors backward.

discovery.text: Each layer adjusts its weights based on how much it contributed to the final error.

twist.text: The idea had been discovered multiple times before, but this time computers were powerful enough.

climax.text: Backpropagation unlocked deep networks. Without it, modern AI wouldn't exist.

punchline.text: Learn from mistakes, layer by layer.

quiz.question: What does backpropagation do?
options: Adjusts neural network weights by propagating errors backward
